refnamediv.refpurpose: Enables an instrument to turn itself off or to turn an instance of another instrument off.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Enables an instrument to turn itself off or to turn an instance of another instrument off.

refsect1.title: Initialization
refsect1.para: inst -- when used with an i-time parameter, this is the instance handle of an instrument to be turned off (obtained from the nstance opcode).
refsect1.title: Performance
refsect1.para: turnoff -- with no parameters this p-time statement enables an instrument to turn itself off. Whether of finite duration or held, the note currently being performed by this instrument is immediately removed from the active note list. No other notes are affected.
kinst -- when used with an k-time parameter, this is the instance handle of an instrument to be turned off (obtained from the nstance opcode).

refsect1.title: Examples
refsect1.para:
The following example uses the turnoff opcode. It will cause a note to terminate when a control signal passes a certain threshold (here the Nyquist frequency). It uses the file turnoff.csd.
